oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Austin Peay
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A portrait of Austin Peay who was Governor of Tennessee from 1923 to 1927.

During the 1920s, Austin Peay served as the governor of Tennessee and was a leader in promoting the conservation of natural resources. Under his leadership as governor, the legislature passed a $2 million bond bill for the purchase of land for the Great Smoky Mountains National Park.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politicians
Photographs
